title: Daily Market Digest: Tariffs Spark Broad Sell-off
subtitle: February 23, 2026

items.headline: US Equities Plunge Amid Renewed Tariff Uncertainty
items.summary: U.S. stock markets experienced a significant downturn today, with all major indices diving more than 1.5% in a high-velocity sell-off. The aggressive downturn followed a pivotal Supreme Court ruling that struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping emergency tariff policies, triggering an immediate and fiery retaliation from the White House with new 15% across-the-board tariffs. Overall market sentiment was highly cautious, with trading volume surging amid panic selling and reflecting broad-based declines across sectors.

items.headline: Arcellx ($ACLX) Surges on Acquisition News
items.summary: Shares of Arcellx jumped 78% after Gilead Sciences agreed to acquire the biotech for $115 per share in cash plus a CVR, valuing the deal at approximately $7.8 billion.

items.headline: Vanda Pharmaceuticals ($VNDA) Rises on FDA Approval
items.summary: Vanda Pharmaceuticals shares surged 49% following FDA approval of Bysanti (milsaperidone) for bipolar I disorder and schizophrenia.

items.headline: Veris Residential ($VRE) Climbs on Acquisition Deal
items.summary: Multifamily REIT Veris Residential saw shares climb 12% after exceeding Q4 results and agreeing to be acquired by an investor group for $19 per share in cash.

items.headline: Gossamer Bio ($GOSS) Plummets
items.summary: Gossamer Bio, Inc. experienced a significant drop, closing down 80.38% today.

items.headline: United Homes Group ($UHG) Faces Steep Decline
items.summary: United Homes Group, Inc. shares fell sharply, down 50.42%.

items.headline: Novo Nordisk ($NVO) Drops After Drug Trial Failure
items.summary: Shares of Novo Nordisk plunged 15% after its experimental obesity drug CagriSema failed to meet a key endpoint.

items.headline: Tesla ($TSLA) Slides Amid Broader Tech Weakness
items.summary: Tesla dropped 3.31% today to $398.20 as 'Magnificent Seven' stocks took a hit.

items.headline: Supreme Court Rules Against Trump Tariffs, New Tariffs Imposed
items.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled 6-3 that President Trump did not have the authority to impose tariffs under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA). In response, President Trump announced new 15% across-the-board tariffs, leading to market jitters.

items.headline: Fed Governor Waller Expresses Skepticism on Jobs Data, Hints at March Rate Cut
items.summary: Federal Reserve Board Governor Christopher Waller spoke on the economic outlook, expressing skepticism regarding the January jobs surge and suggesting a possible 25-basis-point reduction in the policy rate could be appropriate at the March meeting if February labor market data is weak.

items.headline: Q4 2025 GDP Misses Estimates, Core PCE Accelerates
items.summary: The U.S. GDP for Q4 2025 grew at an annual rate of 1.4%, missing the consensus estimate of 2.9%. Core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) accelerated to 3.0%, higher than expectations, driven largely by inflation in services prices.

items.headline: Geopolitical Tensions Drive Up Gold, Oil Prices
items.summary: Rising US-Iran tensions have contributed to an increase in oil and gold prices. Gold surged over 2% to $5,200 an ounce today, while Brent crude experienced a slight decline to USD 71.49 per barrel. Bitcoin also dipped below $66,000, signaling risk-off sentiment.

items.headline: AMC Entertainment Holdings Reports Q4 and Full Year 2025 Results
items.summary: AMC Entertainment Holdings, Inc. ($AMC) reported its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025.

items.headline: IT Stocks Face Headwinds from AI Disruption and Downgrades
items.summary: Globally, IT stocks, particularly in the Indian market, were among the top losers today. Analysts attributed the correction to AI-driven disruption in the IT sector and global brokerage downgrades.

items.statContext: Slightly positive movement on Friday, but likely down in today's broader market decline.
Faced headwinds due to broader market decline and AI disruption.
